tit.cmt: 後で、「Motoi no Miko」という表現が出てくるので、Oは離しておいた方が理解しやすいと思います。

sen.j: 基王（もといおう、神亀4年9月29日 (旧暦)（727年11月20日） - 神亀5年9月13日 (旧暦)（728年10月24日））は、聖武天皇の第1皇子。
sen.e: Prince Motoi (November 20, 727 - October 24, 728) was the first Prince of Emperor Shomu.
Prince Motoi (November 20, 727 - October 24, 728) was the first Prince of Emperor Shomu.
Prince Motoi (November 20, 727 - October 24, 728) was the first Prince of Emperor Shomu.

sen.j: 基皇子（もといのみこ）とも。
sen.e: He was also called Prince Motoi (Motoi no Miko).
He was also called Motoi no Miko.
sen.cmt: 不要な箇所は削除しました。
sen.e: He was also called Motoi no Miko.

sen.j: また『本朝皇胤紹運録』にはただ「親王」とのみ掲げられており、その説明書きとして「諱基王」と記されている。
sen.e: Furthermore, in "Honcho koin jounroku" (the Emperor's family tree, made in the Muromachi period), he was listed only as 'Imperial Prince' with an explanation as 'Imina (real personal name) Prince Motoi.'
Furthermore, in "Honcho koin jounroku" (the Emperor's family tree, made in the Muromachi period), he was listed only as 'Imperial Prince' with an explanation as 'Imina Prince Motoi.'
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にするため、一部削除しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, in "Honcho koin jounroku" (the Emperor's family tree, made in the Muromachi period), he was listed only as 'Imperial Prince' with an explanation as 'Imina Prince Motoi.'

sen.j: そのことから、これは「諱某王」の誤記であり、実名は不明であるとする説もある。
sen.e: Due to the above, some say that the explanation was written in error which should have been 'a certain Prince' and his real name was unknown.
Because of that, some say that the explanation was written in error, which should have been 'Prince Motoi (uncertain).'
sen.cmt: 下記のサイトの内容からすると、「諱某王」ではなく、「某基王」になると思われるので、そのように解釈し、変更しました。http://www.asahi-net.or.jp/~sg2h-ymst/motoi.html
sen.e: Because of that, some say that the explanation was written in error, which should have been 'Prince Motoi (uncertain).'

sen.j: 「基」と命名されたのであれば、まだ親王宣下の慣行が存在しない当時、誕生とともに自動的に「基親王」とされたはずだからである。
sen.e: In view of the no custom of giving the title of Imperial Prince by an imperial order existing at that time, he should have been automatically given the title of 'Prince Motoi' upon his birth, if he was named as 'Motoi.'

Since there was no custom of giving the title of Imperial Prince by an imperial order at the time, he should have been automatically given the title of 'Prince Motoi' upon his birth if he was named as 'Motoi.'
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にするため、一部修正しました。ifの前の不要なカンマを削除しました。
sen.e: Since there was no custom of giving the title of Imperial Prince by an imperial order at the time, he should have been automatically given the title of 'Prince Motoi' upon his birth if he was named as 'Motoi.'

sen.j: 聖武天皇と光明皇后とのあいだに生まれた唯一の男子である。
sen.e: He was the only son of Emperor Shomu and Empress Komyo.
He was the only son of Emperor Shomu and Empress Komyo.
He was the only son of Emperor Shomu and Empress Komyo.

sen.j: 待望の男子を得た天皇の喜びはひととおりではなく、生後わずか32日、11月2日 (旧暦)（12月22日）には皇太子に立てられた。
sen.e: When the Emperor got a long-hoped-for son, he felt no ordinary degree of joy and made the son installed as Crown Prince only 32 days after the birth.
When the Emperor finally got a son, he felt great joy and installed the son as a Crown Prince only 32 days after his birth.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にするため、一部修正しました。
sen.e: When the Emperor finally got a son, he felt great joy and installed the son as a Crown Prince only 32 days after his birth.

sen.j: 天皇はもちろん皇太子にも成人であることが求められた当時としてはきわめて異例な措置であった。
sen.e: At the time when the adulthood was required for not only an Emperor but also for a Crown Prince, it was an extremely rare move.
At the time when the adulthood was required for not only an Emperor but also for a Crown Prince, it was an extremely rare move.
At the time when the adulthood was required for not only an Emperor but also for a Crown Prince, it was an extremely rare move.

sen.j: しかし、翌年には病気となり、生後1年に満たずに夭逝する。
sen.e: Prince Motoi, however, died young less than one year after his birth.
Prince Motoi, however, became sick the next year and died less than a year after his birth.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れです。（翌年には病気となり）一部不要な箇所を削除、変更しました。
sen.e: Prince Motoi, however, became sick the next year and died less than a year after his birth.

sen.j: 死後は那保山に葬られた。
sen.e: He was buried in Nahoyama.
sen.cmt: 「那保山」の読みは、下記サイトから引用しました。http://d.hatena.ne.jp/ikutayasuhiko/20081012
sen.e: He was buried on Mt. Naho.
sen.cmt: スタイル違反(Mt.○○)です。前置詞が違います。
sen.e: He was buried on Mt. Naho.

sen.j: この早すぎる死は左大臣長屋王の呪詛によるものだという噂を生んだ。
sen.e: That too early death created a rumor that it was due to execration by Sadaijin (Minister of the left) Prince Nagaya.
That too early death created a rumor that it was due to the execration by Sadaijin (the minister of the left) Prince Nagaya.
That too early death created a rumor that it was due to the execration by Sadaijin (the minister of the left) Prince Nagaya.

sen.j: それは、長屋王の持つ有力な皇位継承権者としての立場ともあいまって、わが子を強く哀惜する聖武天皇に長屋王への不信感を生じさせた。
sen.e: While Prince Nagaya was in a strong position as a successor to the Imperial Throne, the rumor raised distrust toward Prince Nagaya on the part of Emperor Shomu who deeply mourned over his son's death.
Since Prince Nagaya was in a strong position as a successor to the Imperial Throne, the rumor made Emperor Shomu, who deeply mourned over his son's death, distrust Prince Nagaya.
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にするため、一部修正しました。
sen.e: Since Prince Nagaya was in a strong position as a successor to the Imperial Throne, the rumor made Emperor Shomu, who deeply mourned over his son's death, distrust Prince Nagaya.

sen.j: そして、讒言による政治的粛清である長屋王の変へとつながってゆくことになる。
sen.e: And, that ended up gradually leading to the Nagayao no Hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao) which was a political purge caused by a slander.
And that gradually lead to the Nagayao no Hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao, a political purge caused by a slander).
sen.cmt: 文の流れを自然にするため、一部削除、修正しました。
sen.e: And that gradually lead to the Nagayao no Hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao, a political purge caused by a slander).
